attributes.action: Demand the EU accounts are fully disclosed. Not been audited in 20 years.
attributes.background: The accounts going back to 1994 have shown material errors, and apparently from 1994 - 2006, they have been "not entirely" fair or accurate.  Are these accounts ever released for public scrutiny? It's administered by the EU's own "Court of auditors" who give their opinion. Their own people? Why?
attributes.additional_details:
https://fullfact.org/europe/did-auditors-sign-eu-budget/

Let's see the accounts and let 'our' auditors have a look at them.  Make things open and transparent.  Or isn't that allowed in the EU?

attributes.action: Accept Functional Skills as an equivalent qualification for EYE's Level 3
attributes.background: I am very concerned about the negative impact of the Government’s decision that all Level 3 Early Years Educators must have at least a C grade in GCSE English and maths with no equitable alternative such as Functional Skills allowed.
attributes.additional_details: Your policy will mean there will be a significant shortfall in the number of Level 3 childcare practitioners, which threatens the quality of care that children will get in early years settings.

attributes.action: Extend the timetable for district councils to submit their Local plans
attributes.background: Plans based their housing numbers on several factors (migration, economic growth, etc). The data supporting these factors may no longer be valid given the significant risks that have emerged post BREXIT. Councils should be required to review the risks and reconfirm their housing requirements.

attributes.action: Implement RSPCA approved standards to all UK livestock farms
attributes.background: We must keep adhering to the 5 Freedoms. EU standards require animals to be inspected once a day, sow stalls are still used for the first 4 weeks of pregnancy, meat chickens have avg. 7cm of space (33kg per m² avg. weight 2.4kg), 550cm² for egg laying hens, calves are only put into groups at 8 weeks
attributes.additional_details:
RSPCA welfare standards should be implemented as the standard practice: http://science.rspca.org.uk/sciencegroup/farmanimals/standards
EU law: 
http://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/3818623/eu-law-on-the-welfare-of-farm-animals.pdf
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/animal-welfare#on-farm-animal-welfare

If we can't improve our standards to RSPCA level, it is paramount these animals do not have to endure any more suffering than they already do under EU law. Ideal: CCTV in livestock farms for RSPCA to access

attributes.action: an amendment to the Weights and Measures Act 1985 to allow Pound and Ounces.
attributes.background:
We the undersigned would like to be able to buy and sell goods in Pounds and Ounces. All it would take is a small amendment to the Weights and Measures Act 1985 to allow us to buy and sell goods in Pound and Ounces.  



This is a Zider Party campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
To sell goods in pounds and ounces was made illegally by the weights and measures Act 1985.

All we ask is for a small amendment to the Weight and Measures Act 1985 to allow us to use pounds and ounces to buy and sells goods.

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Jo Cox in Parliament Square.
attributes.background: Jo Cox was brutally murdered at her constituency surgery.  Jo was a well loved and respected campaigner and MP who always stood up for others.  Parliament Square has 11 statues, none of women.

attributes.action: Stop Government wrecking our Free BBC. Leave our BBC alone.
attributes.background: Government intend to draw up new proposals for a 'radical overhaul' in how the BBC is governed & audited. Currently the government hands over our licence fee monies in order to pay for our beloved BBC. In recent years there have been drastic cuts & reshaping but these new measures are very worrying.
attributes.additional_details: This is a totalitarian tactic damaging the impartiality of the BBC. The BBC is the only juggernaut working on behalf of the public with everyone's interests at heart. It's possible that if we allow government to rip the heart out of this organisation then, eventually, there will be very little truth being broadcast to the population. We cannot rely on the newspapers alone as they don't belong to us, & b) Many, including The Daily Mail & the Sun are owned by people such as Rupert Murdoch

attributes.action: 23rd April to become Prince George of Cambridge’s Official birthday
attributes.background:
Currently our beloved Queen Elizabeth II has two birthdays, real and official.

I would like to propose the future King, Prince George of Cambridge (22nd July) also has an official birthday which would be the 23rd April, St George’s Day, thus giving the England a jolly good reason to celebrate!

attributes.action: Make legal Medical Cannabinoid Oil For personal use. Available to all patients
attributes.background: Documentated evidence  CB1 CB2 cannabinoids work  In regards to a test subject in Tenerife Certainly reporting positive feedback in regards to full relief from symptoms of Parkinson Disease
attributes.additional_details: Witness reports available from Kevin himself. His wife Susan. Myself the producer of the health oil.

attributes.action: Bring back Coursework for GCSE English language and Literature and Humanities.
attributes.background: I am someone that reaped the fruits of coursework and controlled assessments. It allowed me to learn how to produce academic literature, the kind one needs in the real world. The current changes to the GCSE represent a desire to return to a tried, tested and failed system based on rote learning.
attributes.additional_details: Coursework allows students an opportunity to express their voices and opinions in an education system that seems content in becoming pure indoctrination. It lets them showcase, articulate and evaluate all that they know and have learnt as well as applying this abstract knowledge to real issues. It's all well and good for children to learn of Shakespeare and his plays but not knowing how to properly formulate arguments which are logical and coherent will hinder them in the future.

attributes.action: Stop or rethink the current pet passport system and bring back quarantine laws
attributes.background:
Following the recent case of babesiosis in Essex where two dogs have been destroyed I call for a review on the transportation and movement of domestic animal to and from our country.
I propose that quarantine restrictions are reinstated so that disease and illness is not missed in incubation period
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has previously been free of Babesiosis, Rabies and other disease and viruses found on the continent. Its my view it should stay this way especially due to our dense population and the risk of major outbreak is high. Take foot and mouth disease as an example of just how prolific the spread of disease can be and that only affected a controlled animal population.
We have put our borders in a situation that bring much avoidable risk and has allowed easy movement of puppies and stolen pets

attributes.action: MPs to have work experience, including a public service, prior to sitting.
attributes.background:
I feel in order to represent the general public as an MP it is important to have an understanding of various working backgrounds of their constituents.
Many Members of Parliament have little or no experience of 'ordinary work.'

attributes.action: Allow vulnerable, unaccompanied minors into the UK
attributes.background:
Medical volunteers helping in Calais report they have treated 7 boys aged between 14 & 16 in the past six months who claimed to have been raped. All had injuries consistent with these claims. 
We call on the British government to ease the path of entry to minors with legitimate claims to asylum.
attributes.additional_details:
There are over 400 unaccompanied children in the Calais Jungle and tens of thousands across the continent. They are the most vulnerable of the vulnerable. They have travelled hundreds of miles without the protection of adults or families.
Many have relatives in the UK and a legitimate claim to enter the country. 
In January, a senior representative of Europol estimated that 10,000 unaccompanied children had gone missing within Europe.

attributes.action: Raising the minimum wage for 18 year olds.
attributes.background:
The government in their "master plan" to raise the minimum wage has not accounted for the many 18 year old's either not living at home for whatever reason or trying to contribute to a less well off family and have made it near impossible to make a liveable wage 
the current rate is £5.30 per hour

attributes.action: Scrap Income Tax for pensioners on limited income, who have to pay care costs.
attributes.background: My father has an income of c£12000 pa from pensions he paid into from age 14. He is now a 95 year old, disabled war veteran who pays£16350 for care 3 x a day, so he can stay in his own home. In addition he has running costs for his house,constant central heating set at 21 degrees, council tax, food.
attributes.additional_details: I understand from Internet posts, people in residential care are liable to income tax and in this area it costs £1350 per week to live in a good care home (no such thing as an excellent care home) and it is £950 per week for a bad care home! When I spoke to a person from DWP, she confirmed there is no tax exemption. Dad like many of his generation has savings, because he worked from age 14, did not smoke or drink, no holidays abroad and did not spend on his house which is now in disrepair.

attributes.action: Introduce a Singapore style additional stamp duty for overseas buyers in London.
attributes.background:
London's painful housing crisis is being exacerbated by Foreign Investors using the city's property market as a shelter for 
dirty money.

The government of Singapore responded to similar speculation by introducing an additional 15% tax on foreign purchasers in the city state.
attributes.additional_details:
Research by Knight Frank shows in Prime Central London 49% of sales go to overseas buyers, while in inner London the figure is 20%.

'Buy-to-Leave' investment has irreversibly changed many of London's most famous neighborhoods, with whole streets of 'ghost houses'.

The weakness of the global economy and instability in traditional investments if making the problem worse; as the global wealthy look for a safe parking place for their money.

attributes.action: Introduce a standard low rate VAT on Gym Memberships.
attributes.background:
Unlike other businesses that can claim back VAT from business expenses gyms have very few expenses to claim back.
Gyms give a life line for the community educating the public how to live healthy lives a valid reason to consider a lower rate this will help the government health budget and save money

attributes.action: Repeal the 1988 and 1997 Firearms Acts.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, petition the government to repeal the 1997 and 1988 Firearms Act. We believe that law-abiding people should be allowed to own firearms prohibited under these laws, should they wish to do so. These acts were knee-jerk reactions and have done nothing to decrease violent crime.

attributes.action: Create a system in which breached child contact orders can be enforced quickly
attributes.background: Parents are being ripped away from their children for months after a separation while they await a court hearing. They spend thousands to get a court order which, if breached, has to be brought to court to be enforced. The wronged parent incurs all costs and is again seperated from his/her children.
attributes.additional_details: The parent breaching the court order is breaking the law yet it is the other parent, and the children, who suffer. It can take 4 months to get a date for the original order to be enforced which is unacceptable. The parent breaching the court order should be forced to pay all costs and this process should take a maximum of, for example, 30 days. This will minimise the emotional impact on the children and parents whilst reducing the occurance of breached orders.

attributes.action: Abolish chancel repair liability
attributes.background: Chancel repair liability is an outdated burden created when Henry VIII destroyed monasteries and gave away their land, rarely mentioned in  deeds to property, but by which some property owners have been asked to pay the cost of repairing the chancel of the church relevant to their property.
attributes.additional_details:
Claims for payment are usually based on old maps of former church property.  Church and diocese records which might relate to this matter are often incomplete or non-existent or have been destroyed because no one realised that they might have some significance.

Lord Avebury's Bill to abolish chancel repair liability in the House of Lords fell due to lack of time in the parliamentary session before the general election in 2015.  The property of many people is subject to chancel repair notices.

attributes.action: Introduce a new written UK Constitution
attributes.background: In the wake of the UK's imminent exit from the EU, we need a written Constitution at this time of uncertainty to shape the relationship between the citizens and the state. We need a written Constitution that reflects the values of a modern society that is tolerant, pluralistic and multicultural.
attributes.additional_details: The immediate legal consequences of leaving the EU are far-reaching and uncertain for fundamental rights of UK citizens. We need a set of ground rules that we understand and which respect our fundamental rights and freedoms in matters of employment law, property, housing, healthcare, education, children and access to courts. The drafting of a new UK Constitution should not be delayed.

attributes.action: Ban all chocolate made by child labour from entering the UK.
attributes.background: Thousands of children from different parts of the world are captured and sold into slavery to work on cocoa plantation farms for the use of large chocolate companies. Sign this petition to help these children gain back their rights and freedom.
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently over 27 million slaves world-wide and 9 million of these are children sold into various trades. 

We want to help tackle this issue by first tackling the chocolate trade by banning chocolate that is cultivated by children from entering the UK. This ban would raise world-wide awareness on an issue, which is currently being ignored.

attributes.action: Give ALL Uni Students EQUAL opportunity for same amount of living grant (loan)
attributes.background: Currently a Student loan for living costs is given on the basis of household income - so if you have 2 average earning Parents that live together the Student can get £3800 per Yr this DOES NOT even cover their rent in halls - if those Parents separated the Student can get £8000 loan per Yr WRONG!!

attributes.action: Stop forced adoption. It's destroying families, our children are not your profit
attributes.background: We need a full investigation on how SS work taking children from their mum when no acutal harm has come to their child, however they say that there 'could be potential harm'. It costs more to adopt out then to keep the baby with the mother, something needs to be done, our children are at risk.
attributes.additional_details: forced adoption happens in secret family courts, a council are given a target to meet on how many babies/children they need to adopt to get bonuses. John hemming, a known mp who knows all about this matter and sees the doings. Understandingly I know ss have the duty of care to a child I don't disputes that but ever since baby p (bless hes soul) mothers that wouldn't put their babies at harm are paying the price or living the consequences of how you had a bad up bringing

attributes.action: change the law so a child cant leave home at 16years old
attributes.background: because it is a parents responsibility to make sure a child stops in full time education until they are 18years old.
attributes.additional_details: if your child doesn't come home one Sunday night and you know where they are but you haven't given your permission for your child to stay out the police cant help you get your child home, so you can make sure your child attends school

attributes.action: Ban horse racing to stop anymore deaths
attributes.background: Five horses have died too are selfish needs how many more?
attributes.additional_details: As people know five horses has died 🐎🐎🐎🐎🐎 how many more? It needs too stop it's not right! It's not fair! I don't have a problem with betting but what I do have a problem with is gambling on lives theses horses have lives and hearts and are constantly put under strain all for a selfish human ways please please help it stop

attributes.action: Footcare to be free of charge to residents in care homes maintaining mobility.
attributes.background: Care home residents are unable to care for their own feet due to mobility and/or mental impairments. They have to cover care costs, and are left with very limited personal funds. Neglected foot health can lead to other health problems and limitations of mobility this care should be provided.

attributes.action: Force Mr.Cameron to stick to his promises to increase spending on mental health
attributes.background: Mental illness is an illness like any other. Yet cuts to resources are continuously being made, and those who need help, cannot always find it, living a life of seclusion and loneliness. You can see a broken arm or leg, but you cannot see a broken mind, often leading to despair.
attributes.additional_details: It is estimated 1 in 4 people in Britain suffer from, or have suffered from some form of Mental illness. There is a lot of Stigma attached to this distressing condition, many do not seek help because of the risk of verbal or physical abuse, and live a life of seclusion, often resulting in suicide. Those who seek help, cannot find it as there is nowhere to go, GP's are not trained in this field, and cannot make a diagnosis or know what to prescribe. Mental Health resources must be increased.

attributes.action: Re-instate the death penalty
attributes.background: £105,000. That is how much money it costs to house a murderer for a year. That money is taxpayer's money. Your money. Not only this, but why would we want to keep evil people in the system anyway. Obviously, there are limits - mental illness, self-defence etc., but some people won't change.

attributes.action: Make tinted/mirrored motorbike visors legal
attributes.background: almost all bikers have the problem of having the sun in there eyes at one point or another this can be very dangerous if not lethal,not being able to see where you are going or any dangers that may appear could cause a accident or death.Such thing as tinted visors could make everyday safer.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage to £10/hr and ban 0hr contracts.
attributes.background: We the undersigned hereby demand that the national minimum wage is to be raised to £10/hr and continue to raise it in line with inflation. Additionally we also demand that the government ban zero hour contracts.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of basic foods such as eggs, milk, bread, flour etc. has nearly tripled in the last 10 years. (+%300) The NMW however has only incrased a fraction compared to that. This move would not only improve the quality of life for britain's poorest working families but also take many people of benefits and even encourage more people to work thereby freeing up money to be spent elsewhere. This petition is also aimed to stop employers exploiting 0hr contracts.

attributes.action: Require at least 80% of MPs to attend debates held as a result of a petition
attributes.background: The British government implemented an official petition system to hear the needs of the people. However, it is failing its purpose: petitions reaching 100,000 signatures are debated, but often by a very small number of attending MPs. This must change to force the government to hear our wishes.
attributes.additional_details:
The petition to "accept more asylum seekers and increase support for refugee migrants in the UK" was signed by over 450,000 citizens, but only 27 MPs turned up to debate.

The petition to "make the production, sale and use of cannabis legal" received almost 250,000 signatures, yet even fewer of our elected MPs turned up to debate.

The petition system in its current form is a method for the government to systematically ignore the wishes of the electorate. This needs to change.

attributes.action: NHS to provide an optional antenatal class for mums with one or more child.
attributes.background: Having given birth 3 years ago, I’d forgotten lots by the time I had my 2nd child. My network of mums were back at work and there was no antenatal support. I faced debilitating anxiety after birth and it was hugely isolating.An antenatal class would have provided support a GP appointment can’t give.
attributes.additional_details: Recent stats show 1 in 7 ladies experience depression after birth. Yet there is little support for 2nd/3rd time mums. The challenges and q's you have 2nd time are different. By putting in place such a support session, it would provide many ladies with the ability to work through many of the challenges themselves/ together, without having to rely on GPs and Health Visitors, and help decrease the burden on the already stretched health service. It would help them feel that they weren’t alone.

attributes.action: Create a register of In-House Lobbyists and a public record of their activities.
attributes.background: To ensure public interest is not drowned out by corporate spending, it should be transparent who is professionally engaged in attempting to influence Her Majesty's Government on behalf of entities that operate for profit.
attributes.additional_details: Free and open access to government is an important matter of public interest. In order to make HMG more open and democratic, In-house Lobbyists should be required to disclose information about themselves and the subject matter of their lobbying to public office holders and the general public, as well as details of their oral and arranged communications with HMG. The system of registration of paid lobbyists should not impede free and open access to government.

attributes.action: Thinner lenses be free on the NHS for those registered partially sighted/blind
attributes.background: I was registered as partially sighted at 16 and blind at 19. My eyesight is constantly deteriorating and at a quicker pace than most. The need for glasses is essential. I now require complex lenses, thinner lenses are essential and they are very costly.
attributes.additional_details:
Those with complex lenses do get a voucher but that only equates to approximately £14. One pair of glasses cost me nearly £300.

The buy one get one free offers advertised do not include thinner lenses so if a second pair is required (eg prescription sunglasses which with some conditions light has a major impact) you have to pay twice for the lenses.

I currently have thinner lenses in my latest pair and from the side they are at least 0.75cm thick so would be considerably worse without

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to determine what alternative to EU membership the UK wants.
attributes.background: After being given the choice of remaining or leaving the EU in the recent referendum, it is only proper that the people of the UK should have the right to choose what type of relationship they want with the EU so that the government has better guidance in its negotiations.
attributes.additional_details:
The main alternatives to membership in the EU are set out in the Cabinet Office's policy paper "Alternatives to membership: possible models for the United Kingdom outside the European Union, dated 2 March 2016.  Remaining in the EU should be one of the choices in case people do not like the alternatives.  The choices should be:

1) Be a member of the European Economic Area
2) Negotiate a bilateral agreement with the EU
3) Be a member of the World Trade Organisation
4) Remain a member of the EU

attributes.action: Abolish the banned dog breed list
attributes.background: The banned dog breed list is inhumane against the dogs on it. The police can seize a dog if they think it is a Pitbull. So any cross Staffie could be classed as a pitbull in the police's eyes. No dog is aggressive unless the owner makes them. The owners are to blame not the dog.
attributes.additional_details:
Banned dogs
In the UK, it’s against the law to own certain types of dog. These are the:

Pit Bull Terrier
Japanese Tosa
Dogo Argentino
Fila Braziliero

If your dog matches many of the characteristics of a Pit Bull Terrier, it may be a banned type.
A police or council dog expert will judge what type of dog you have and it will be kept in kennels while the police (or council) apply to a court
You’re not allowed to visit your dog while you wait for the court decision.

attributes.action: Change the law so child sex offenders do not have contact with their children
attributes.background: Most children are protected by the law in areas that prevents child sex offenders having access to places where children are present . However children of sex offenders are not privy to the protection and given access to manipulators and grooming behaviour under supervision of unqualified people.
attributes.additional_details: If a child isn't a social services child , and the other parent poses no threat then social services will not supervise,or provide centres. As a result it forces the supervisor which may be a family member or ex partner, to have them into their homes or be witnessed by others associating with a known sex offender. This may put the child's safety at risk .If the supervisor isn't educated about grooming they may inadvertadly put the child at risk.Why are our children not worth adequate protection?

attributes.action: Create a free fast-track citizenship programme for current resident EU citizens
attributes.background: This petition calls on Parliament to create a fast-track citizenship programme at no cost for all non-native EU citizens who wish to remain in the UK following our exit from the EU.

attributes.action: All NHS trusts should provide dual diagnosis treatment
attributes.background:
When mental health problems and substance misuse co-exist, this is known as a dual diagnosis. 22-44% of all adult inpatients in England also have a substance misuse problem and 22% of all suicides are linked to alcohol use.

Why are so many people falling through the net?
attributes.additional_details:
Many NHS trusts simply refuse to make a mental health diagnosis if the individual is under the influence of alcohol.  Without an assessment, an appropriate referral cannot be made and treatment cannot be given, leaving the individual to continue self-medicating while their physical and mental health deteriorates. 

Sectioning or suicide shouldn't be the only options left. 

Early intervention is vital. More funding is needed. More training. More communication. More person-centred treatment.

attributes.action: Legalise the right to own and open/conceal carry a taser and/or pepper spray.
attributes.background: Through the years it has become more off a reality that the public is threatened. Police are no longer able to adequitley protect us. Tasers and pepper spray are non leathal and we should be allowed to carry them. As a human i have the right to protect myself and should be allowed to use these.
attributes.additional_details:
Rape is on the rise across the UK. Woman in particular are quite often not able to defend themselves and should be allowed to carry such defensive weapons as a taser or pepper spray. 

If a potential rapist, mugger etc saw a taser holstered to a persons hip they would be less inclined to carry out the crime. Same as if employees in shops had acess to one less robberies would take place. Common sense? Yes i think so.

attributes.action: Levy a 15% tax on shooting goods to fund moorland restoration and flood relief.
attributes.background: Heather burning and draining for the purpose of increasing red grouse production destroys peat and moss causing it to retain less water. As a result, heavy rain which used to be held by the peat and moss wetlands now makes fast runoff from the uplands and causes flooding in the valleys.
attributes.additional_details: Since the cause is specifically driven by the need to increase grouse numbers for shooting, it would seem appropriate that those causing the issue should bear the cost of reparation work. Therefore, I ask the government to impose an additional 15% charge on all shooting goods of all types, to fund restoration projects carried out by major conservation charities along with providing extra funding for those affected by the resulting flooding

attributes.action: EU citizens working & living in the UK for 10 years should earn full suffrage
attributes.background:
Many of us have lived & worked in the UK for most of our adult lives. Some of us have studied here too. We feel British: our families, our friends are British. This is our nation and we form the British society.
British-borns earn full suffrage at 18. Commonwealth citizenships can vote straightaway
attributes.additional_details: When you are a European citizen who has been working and living in the UK for 18 years - had I been born here I could vote in General Elections. Someone whose home is in Britain - whose family & friends are British. Someone who works hard and looks after her 'home': her street, her neighbourhood, her village, her town, her city, her region, her country. However, your 'country' does not allow you to look after it. You cannot choose a Prime Minister because you are not allowed full suffrage.

attributes.action: Put an end to the Cayman Island's tax haven status
attributes.background: Currently it is legal for businesses in the UK to divert their profits to the Cayman Islands and as a result do not have to pay tax on these profits. This costs the British public £20 billion per year, the same amount that the government are cutting from public services over the next 4 years.
attributes.additional_details: "Its been estimated that legal tax avoidance keeps 20 billion pounds out of the UK treasury every year. That's exactly the same amount being cut by government departments, delivering services to us in the next 4 years" http://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/b06wrt2d/britains-trillion-pound-island-inside-cayman

attributes.action: Make Disclosure & Barring Service financially accountable for checks over 60days
attributes.background: The Disclosure and Barring Service has not managed the reported back log within the Metropolitan police well. This has resulted in people, predominantly in the health sector being unable to work. This for many has led to emotional and financial difficulty; through no fault of their own.

attributes.action: The European Union referendum should not be held before September 2016.
attributes.background: The EU referendum is a "once in a lifetime decision", to rush to holding the referendum as early as June would be foolish.  This is too close to both the local elections, the exam season and limits the ambitions of the negotiations; it affords no time to consider alternatives. Why rush?
attributes.additional_details: The proposed renegotiated terms highlight the lack of ambition in seeking to reform our membership and the lack of value placed on the United Kingdom as a member nation. We would risk influencing decision making in elections to the devolved administrations and local government because party positions on the EU would have to be explained alongside their manifesto. Young first time voters and students would only just be through exam season and lack the time to comprehend the meaning of their vote.

attributes.action: This Government to do more to support our steel industry and train builders
attributes.background: The government gives out the franchises to overseas companies when doing so there should be a proviso that when new rolling stock is required British built should be the norm.Thereby safeguarding jobs in the steel and train building industries.

attributes.action: Allow NON-EU parents/ family members of British Citizens to settle in UK.
attributes.background:
Following my dad's terminal illness, my family (I, my wife & son) relocated to India in 2014 to look after my dad & support my mum.
Since I have lost my dad, we want to return home (London) but I can't leave my elderly mum (who has already gone through a lot since 2012) on her own in India.
attributes.additional_details:
I, my wife & son are UK Citizens. We own a house in London & had decent jobs in financial service industry until we moved our center of life to India in Apr'14.
Following my dad's demise, I'm desperate to return to our home in London but are forced to stay in India as UK won't let my mum in to settle & I can't leave her alone!  UK allows non EU family of EU immigrants under EU law but can't do the same for it's own citizens. Is this the price we have to pay for being UK citizens & tax payers?

attributes.action: Re enact the 1955 canal closure act of parliament.
attributes.background: The Northern reaches of the Lancaster canal were cut off from the main line in 1968.To make way for the M6 motorway,the Locks were de commissioned and the canal was severed in several locations.We propose restoration by stages,to encourage New businesses ,especially tourism.
attributes.additional_details: We have support from numerous boating ,restoration societies.And over 500 members of our group.OWD LANKY BOATERS.Both parish and county councils have show support also.

attributes.action: A 5 year ban from public office for politicians who knowingly lie to the public.
attributes.background: The Brexit  debate has frustrated people on both sides. There have been many opinions put forward as facts but there have also been outright lies and some people believed them and are now annoyed. If a citizen said some of these things they would be sued but it seems OK if a politician says them.
attributes.additional_details: £350 million pounds a week will be diverted from the EU to the NHS. 75 million Turks are on their way to Britain.
